title: (Patch 9.7) Extreme Client lag and Extreme In-game FPS drop
body:
my league was running smoothly about a couple weeks ago however my pc updated as did my league client(9.7), after the updates finished i noticed my client was taking a long time to boot up and load everything (roughly 6-8 minutes some times longer) before the update my pc was able to load up the client in just fine in about 2-3 minutes. The client itself is even unresponsive and takes forever to respond to my clicks resulting in me missing queue prompts, even if i do im forced to dodge the lobby due to time out because i cant even pick a champ. I have  low spec mode enabled and i have all settings turned to the lowest possible settings (aka i have potato mode enabled)

I tried to load into a practice tool game and even that was so laggy i couldnt even pick the champ i wanted to test. Once the game loaded my fps dropped to 1-5fps when i was getting 50-60 fps every game. I've invested an embarrassing amount of time and money into this game and ii still have friends that want to play it with me, but at the moment im in no shape to buy a new pc and its just frustrating. any help at all is greatly appreciated.{{sticker:sg-soraka}} 

Steps I have tried:
- Enable lowest settings possible and Low-Spec mode
- Uninstalling and Reinstalling
- Defragmenting hard drive
- Updating drivers
- Factory Reset
- Uninstalling usless software

Here are my specs:
Dell Inspiron 15- 3531
OS - Windows 10 Home 
Processor - Intel(R) Celeron(R) CPU N2830 2.16GHz
Installed Memory(RAM) - 4.00 GB (3.89 GB usable)
64-bit OS

this happens to me, sometimes it lasts like 3 minutes of zero FPS... every time between 6 minutes and 10 minutes game time, only once a game, every single game. sometimes it only lasts a few seconds, normally about 45-60 seconds. i'm proud of myself because i suspected this was on riots end. o well hope its fixed soon

It's 100% a memory leak. I've been having the same issues since the latest patch dropped and I'm using a 3000 euro gaming rig that's barely three years old.
Game will run fine on the highest settings, and just slowly get worse and worse and worse until unplayable, then I have to restart my computer.

Wait it out. Let's hope the devs realize something's up.
Ya this patch made the game unplayable. No matter what graphics settings i put it at, i have random fps drops. Its terrible. gpu and cpu temps are fine. not sure what to do.
You should check if your pcs inside temperatures are too high. Usually fps drops/performance drops are because of heat problems. Maybe that is the issue? 1-5fps is pretty weird tho

It looks like you've tried a few things like Low Spec Mode and some PC maintenance without any avail. Though there are various issues I've seen players report regarding the League Client, I haven't seen something specifically like this. 

From what you've described it would normally sound like a memory leak save the fact that the performance issues you're seeing are happening right after running the client. Normally for memory leak issues, the problem doesn't show up right off the bat, but it just gets worse as time goes on. In either case, it might be helpful to check your Task Manager to see if the League Client is taxing your CPU or how it's utilizing your RAM.

Can you reach out to my colleagues through a Support Site ticket? Please provide the context you've provided here alongside your logs so they can take a look: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

The Hextech Repair Tool can grab all the logs in one go: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367
